newsitem.title: USA: Talbott to visit Paris, Brussels, Moscow on NATO.
newsitem.headline: Talbott to visit Paris, Brussels, Moscow on NATO.

text.p: Little more than a week after Secretary of State Madeleine Albright's first tour, Deputy Secretary of State Strobe Talbott heads for Europe on Monday for further discussions on NATO enlargement and European security issues.
The State Department said Talbott would visit Paris, Brussels and Moscow, returning next Friday.

"He'll be consulting with the French government, with our NATO allies in Brussels, and with the Russian government, about the range of European security issues on which we've been working -- NATO enlargement, the proposed NATO-Russia charter idea, the internal adaptation of NATO, all of the issues that Secretary Albright dealt with in her recent trip to the six capitals in Europe," spokesman Nicholas Burns said.
During her stop in Moscow last Friday, Albright presented the Russian government with a package of NATO proposals designed to allay Moscow's fears about the western alliance's expansion plans.

They included a proposal for significant reductions in conventional armed forces in Europe and a new charter or document that would define the NATO-Russia relationship into the future and give Moscow a voice, but not a veto, in alliance affairs.

Burns said Russian Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov had praise for some parts of the arms reduction proposal and questions about other aspects of it. The proposal will be negotiated in Vienna with Russia, NATO allies and others of the 30 states who signed the 1990 Conventional Forces in Europe Treaty.
